intro_block.intro_title: Into the Wild Heart of India
intro_block.intro_description:
India is one of the world's most biodiverse regions, a land where roaring tigers rule the jungles, prehistoric rhinos graze in tall grasslands, and millions of migratory birds paint the skies. From the snowy leopards of the Himalayas to the elephants of the southern rainforests, the country offers a spectacular array of wildlife experiences.

Our extensive network of National Parks, Bird Sanctuaries, and Flower Valleys preserves these fragile ecosystems. Conservation is at the core of these destinations, ensuring that future generations can witness nature in its rawest form. Whether you seek the thrill of a jeep safari, the silence of a birdwatching boat ride, or the ethereal beauty of a blooming valley, these journeys promise an unforgettable connection with the natural world.

destinations.title: Jim Corbett National Park
destinations.short_description: Home to the majestic Bengal Tiger and diverse flora in the foothills of the Himalayas.

destinations.title: Kaziranga National Park
destinations.short_description: A UNESCO World Heritage site hosting two-thirds of the world's great one-horned rhinoceroses.

destinations.title: Ranthambore National Park
destinations.short_description: A historic park where tigers roam around the ancient Ranthambore Fort.

destinations.title: Gir Forest National Park
destinations.short_description: The only place in the world outside Africa where a lion can be seen in its natural habitat.

destinations.title: Sundarbans National Park
destinations.short_description: The largest mangrove forest in the world, famous for swimming Royal Bengal Tigers.

destinations.title: Bandhavgarh National Park
destinations.short_description: Known for having one of the highest densities of tiger populations in India.

destinations.title: Kanha National Park
destinations.short_description: A vast expanse of sal and bamboo forests, home to the Barasingha and tigers.

destinations.title: Periyar National Park
destinations.short_description: A scenic reserve centered around a lake, famous for elephant sightings and boat safaris.

destinations.title: Bandipur National Park
destinations.short_description: Part of the Nilgiri Biosphere Reserve, sheltering tigers, elephants, and gaurs.

destinations.title: Panna National Park
destinations.short_description: Famous for its wild cats, including tigers, leopards, and gharials in the Ken River.

destinations.title: Manas National Park
destinations.short_description: A biodiversity hotspot known for its Project Tiger, Elephant Reserve, and Biosphere Reserve.

destinations.title: Dudhwa National Park
destinations.short_description: A lush green reserve in the Terai belt, home to swamp deer, tigers, and rhinos.

destinations.title: Great Himalayan National Park
destinations.short_description: High-altitude park known for its biodiversity, trekking, and the elusive snow leopard.

destinations.title: Nagarhole National Park
destinations.short_description: Rich in teak and rosewood, famous for large elephant and bison populations.

destinations.title: Pench National Park
destinations.short_description: The setting for Rudyard Kipling's Jungle Book, straddling MP and Maharashtra.

destinations.title: Sariska National Park
destinations.short_description: Known for successfully relocating tigers, set against the backdrop of the Aravalli hills.

destinations.title: Namdapha National Park
destinations.short_description: India's third-largest national park, harboring four big cat species.

destinations.title: Tadoba National Park
destinations.short_description: Maharashtra's oldest and largest national park, a thriving tiger reserve.

destinations.title: Keoladeo National Park
destinations.short_description: Formerly Bharatpur Bird Sanctuary, a UNESCO site hosting thousands of bird species.

destinations.title: Eravikulam National Park
destinations.short_description: Nestled in the Western Ghats, famous for the endangered Nilgiri Tahr and Neelakurinji blooms.

destinations.title: Silent Valley National Park
destinations.short_description: A core area of the Nilgiri Biosphere Reserve, containing some of the last remaining rainforests of Kerala.

destinations.title: Keibul Lamjao National Park
destinations.short_description: The world's only floating national park, home to the dancing deer 'Sangai' on Loktak Lake.

destinations.title: Desert National Park
destinations.short_description: A vast expanse of Thar Desert ecosystem, the last refuge of the critically endangered Great Indian Bustard.

destinations.title: Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park
destinations.short_description: A protected marine life sanctuary in the Andaman Islands, famous for its coral reefs and sea turtles.

destinations.title: Rani Jhansi Marine National Park
destinations.short_description: A secluded marine park in the Ritchie's Archipelago of the Andamans, ideal for eco-tourism.

destinations.title: Gulf of Mannar Marine National Park
destinations.short_description: South Asia's first marine biosphere reserve, containing 21 islands with rich coral reefs and sea grass beds.

destinations.title: Chilika Lake Bird Sanctuary
destinations.short_description: A massive brackish water lagoon hosting millions of migratory birds and Irrawaddy dolphins.

destinations.title: Sultanpur National Park
destinations.short_description: A popular wetland near Gurugram attracting diverse migratory birds in winter.

destinations.title: Nal Sarovar Bird Sanctuary
destinations.short_description: A vast wetland hosting huge flocks of flamingos, pelicans, and other waterfowl.

destinations.title: Ranganathittu Bird Sanctuary
destinations.short_description: A cluster of islets in the Kaveri river, an important nesting ground for painted storks.

destinations.title: Vedanthangal Bird Sanctuary
destinations.short_description: One of India's oldest sanctuaries, protected by locals for centuries.

destinations.title: Kumarakom Bird Sanctuary
destinations.short_description: Located on the banks of Vembanad Lake, a favorite haunt of migratory birds.

destinations.title: Okhla Bird Sanctuary
destinations.short_description: A haven for waterbirds situated on the Yamuna river at the Delhi-UP border.

destinations.title: Dr. Salim Ali Bird Sanctuary
destinations.short_description: Named after India's Birdman, this mangrove habitat on Chorao Island is teeming with life.

destinations.title: Thattekad Bird Sanctuary
destinations.short_description: Described by Salim Ali as the richest bird habitat in peninsular India.

destinations.title: Kutch Desert Wildlife Sanctuary
destinations.short_description: Located in the Great Rann of Kutch, famous for the 'Flamingo City' where thousands of flamingos breed.

destinations.title: Valley of Flowers
destinations.short_description: A UNESCO site known for its meadows of endemic alpine flowers and varied flora.

destinations.title: Yumthang Valley
destinations.short_description: Famous for its rhododendron forests and hot springs in North Sikkim.

destinations.title: Dzukou Valley
destinations.short_description: A pristine valley at the Nagaland-Manipur border, famous for its unique lily.

destinations.title: Kaas Plateau
destinations.short_description: A UNESCO World Natural Heritage site that transforms into a carpet of flowers after monsoon.

destinations.title: Munnar Tea Gardens
destinations.short_description: Endless rolling hills carpeted with emerald green tea plantations and rare Neelakurinji blooms.

destinations.title: Srinagar Tulip Garden
destinations.short_description: Indira Gandhi Memorial Tulip Garden, a spectacle of millions of blooming tulips.

destinations.title: Ooty Botanical Gardens
destinations.short_description: A historic garden laid out in 1848, famous for its annual flower show.

destinations.title: Khajjiar
destinations.short_description: Known as the 'Mini Switzerland of India', a small plateau with a small stream-fed lake.

destinations.title: Agumbe Rainforest
destinations.short_description: A dense rainforest famous for King Cobras and spectacular sunsets.

sections.title: Wildlife Safaris
sections.description: Discover the Wild Heart of India

seo.seo_title: Wildlife Safaris India | National Parks, Bird Sanctuaries & Flower Valleys
seo.seo_description: Explore India's top wildlife destinations. From tiger safaris in Ranthambore to birdwatching in Chilika and the blooms of Valley of Flowers.
